title: psrcplot Frequently Asked Questions
text: best done prior invoking psrcplot function converting variable Factor datatype levels specified sequence ’d like displayed. case , HRACE variable arrives Factor datatype, still alphabetical default ordering.  Factor levels can reversed using fct_rev() function forcats package.
code: library(magrittr) library(dplyr) library(psrcplot)    hhinc19_x_race <- psrcplot::summary_pums_example_data  # Create chart -- default category ordering    income.chart.default <- static_bar_chart(      t=hhinc19_x_race,      x="HINCP_median", y="HRACE",      fill="DATE",      moe='HINCP_median_moe',      est='currency',      title="Median Household Income by Race - default Race order")  income.chart.default hhinc19_rev <- hhinc19_x_race %>%    mutate(HRACE_REV=forcats::fct_rev(as.factor(HRACE)))  income.chart.reverse <- static_bar_chart(      t=hhinc19_rev,       x="HINCP_median", y="HRACE_REV",      f="DATE",      moe='HINCP_median_moe',      est='currency',      title="Median Household Income by Race - reverse default")  income.chart.reverse

title: psrcplot Frequently Asked Questions
text: may wish order categories data variable instead. uses another forcats function, fct_reorder() (complex multi-variable ordering expressions also possible using function).
code: hhinc19_low_high <- hhinc19_x_race %>%    mutate(HRACE_low_high=forcats::fct_reorder(HRACE, -HINCP_median))  income.chart.low_high <- static_bar_chart(       t=hhinc19_low_high,        x="HINCP_median", y="HRACE_low_high",       fill="DATE",       moe='HINCP_median_moe',       color='psrc_dark',       est='currency',       title="Median Household Income by Race - median income order")  income.chart.low_high

title: psrcplot Frequently Asked Questions
text: Sometimes logic can’t captured alphabetical numeric rank–example, setting remainder combination categories last. , ’ll need order factor levels manually. careful type exact factor names, omitted (ugh).
code: hhinc19_custom <- hhinc19_x_race %>%     mutate(HRACE_custom=factor(HRACE,         levels = c("American Indian or Alaskan Native Alone",                    "Asian alone",                   "Black or African American alone",                   "Hispanic or Latino",                   "Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone",                   "White alone",                   "Some Other Race alone",                   "Two or More Races",                    "Multiple Races")))  income.chart.custom <- static_bar_chart(       t=hhinc19_custom,        x="HINCP_median",        y="HRACE_custom",       fill="DATE",       moe='HINCP_median_moe',       color='psrc_dark',       est='currency',       title= "Regional Household Median Income by Race - custom order")  income.chart.custom

what: How can I wrap the text on a column chart x axis- it’s looking messy!
title: psrcplot Frequently Asked Questions
text: look messy don’t wrap text x-axis often column chart - like :  can fix ugly labels using ggplot2 command text wrapping via stringr package. might need play around str_wrap() parameter get breaks looking nice. leaves category variable data alone (since str_wrap otherwise convert type character lose factor level ordering, etc).
code: income.column.messy <- static_column_chart(       t=hhinc19_custom,        x="HRACE",        y="HINCP_median",       fill="DATE",       moe='HINCP_median_moe',       est='currency',       title= "Regional Household Median Income by Race, lookin messy")  income.column.messy xlabs <- levels(hhinc19_custom$HRACE_custom) %>% stringr::str_wrap(12)  income.column.wrapped <- static_column_chart(       t=hhinc19_custom,        x="HRACE_custom", y="HINCP_median",       f="DATE",       moe='HINCP_median_moe',       est='currency',       title= "Regional Household Median Income by Race, wrapped x- axis label") +   ggplot2::scale_x_discrete(labels=xlabs)  income.column.wrapped

what: X & Y axes for bar charts vs. column charts
title: psrcplot Frequently Asked Questions
text: Bars horizontal columns vertical. column chart, numeric value assigned y-axis, bar chart, numeric value assigned x-axis, displayed.

what: Make an interactive column chart of travel survey data
title: Interactive plotting
text: want create interactive column plot, call function interactive_column_chart specifying t underlying table. Note column chart x variable expected categories, y variable canumeric- since x values categories numeric values represented y axis. example , read example data table shows transit access modes travel survey: data table sent interactive column chart PSRC colors following function: can find functions running ?function_name package. example, ?interactive_column_chart()
code: transit_acc_df <- psrcplot::transit_access_example_data   transit_acc_df ##      survey     mode_acc_walk     count count_moe     share share_moe ## 1 2017_2019 Other Access Mode  76864.68  19849.31 0.1428148 0.0345003 ## 2 2017_2019  Walked or jogged 461347.49  49535.06 0.8571852 0.0345003 ## 3      2021 Other Access Mode  95813.72  26434.51 0.2464731 0.0604748 ## 4      2021  Walked or jogged 292925.31  36395.11 0.7535269 0.0604748 ##   sample_size      year ## 1         334 2017/2019 ## 2        4144 2017/2019 ## 3          78      2021 ## 4         297      2021 # Interactive chart         transit_access_chart<-interactive_column_chart(t=transit_acc_df,                                                 x='mode_acc_walk', y='share', fill='year',                                                 moe='share_moe', est='percent',                                                color="psrc_light", title='Transit Access Mode') transit_access_chart

title: Interactive plotting
text: can save interactive bar chart created programmatically using htmlwidgets library. html version file can embedded webpage.
code: library(htmlwidgets) saveWidget(transit_access_chart,             file=('transit_access.html'))

title: Interactive plotting
text: psrcplot, provide many color ramps approved graphics department. color ramps can used referencing names color=“pgnobgy_5” . can see colors R following function: print_psrc_palette().
code: print_psrc_palette()

what: Make a static bar plot of Census data
title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: want create bar plot, call function static_bar_chart specifying t underlying table. Note static_bar_chart x variable expected numeric, y variable categorical- since numeric values represented x axis y values categories. example , read example data table shows mode share race region: data table sent static_bar_chart PSRC colors following function: can find functions running ?function_name package. example, ?static_bar_chart()
code: mode_shares <- psrcplot::mode_share_example_data %>%   filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%  filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%  mutate(Year = as.character(Year)) mode_shares ##    Year Geography  Race   count count_moe       share    share_moe ## 1  2010    Region Total  403369 10836.103 0.711037977 0.0138130361 ## 2  2010    Region Total   55723  6004.193 0.098225618 0.0102303583 ## 3  2010    Region Total   70898  5562.850 0.124975322 0.0096255011 ## 4  2010    Region Total   32929  3189.047 0.058045535 0.0056401605 ## 5  2010    Region Total    4314  1340.329 0.007604496 0.0023254157 ## 6  2015    Region Total 1577787 15808.465 0.785575621 0.0061570136 ## 7  2015    Region Total  109617  7425.106 0.054577990 0.0036083656 ## 8  2015    Region Total  187841  8902.649 0.093525495 0.0043774057 ## 9  2015    Region Total  117189  7840.840 0.058348067 0.0037042782 ## 10 2015    Region Total   14338  2309.254 0.007138849 0.0011428535 ## 11 2020    Region Total 1620547  8688.810 0.750594831 0.0027689638 ## 12 2020    Region Total  105416  3288.144 0.048825924 0.0014903525 ## 13 2020    Region Total  198435  4574.825 0.091909883 0.0020960216 ## 14 2020    Region Total  217592  4550.691 0.100782903 0.0021255052 ## 15 2020    Region Total   17027  1401.342 0.007886459 0.0006464336 ##                Category           Mode ## 1  Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 2  Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 3  Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 4  Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 5  Mode to Work by Race          Other ## 6  Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 7  Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 8  Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 9  Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 10 Mode to Work by Race          Other ## 11 Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 12 Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 13 Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 14 Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 15 Mode to Work by Race          Other # Static Chart          modes_chart <- static_bar_chart(t=mode_shares, y="Mode",x="share", fill="Year",                                     title="Mode Share to Work",                                     alt="Chart of Work Mode Shares",                                     source=paste("Source: ACS 5-Year Estimates, table B3002",                                                  "for King, Kitsap, Pierce and Snohomish counties.",                                                  sep = "\n"),                                     color="pgnobgy_5") modes_chart

title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: options saving static chart. First can right click plot open R-Studio save file. export static chart programmatically, can use ggplot2 function called ggsave: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggsave.html can save static bar chart created programmatically.
code: ggsave(filename='modes_bar_chart.png', plot=modes_chart, device='png') ## Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image

title: Get Started Making a Static Plot

title: Authors and Citation
text: Craig Helmann. Maintainer. Christy Lam. Author. Megan Gryzbowski. Author. Suzanne Childress. Author. Michael Jensen. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lam C, Gryzbowski M, Childress S, Jensen M (2023). psrcplot: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization. R package version 0.1.0, https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {psrcplot: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization},   author = {Christy Lam and Megan Gryzbowski and Suzanne Childress and Michael Jensen},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/}, }

title: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization
text: Package Creating PSRC consistent data visualizations R Install following command: devtools::install_github("psrc/psrcplot") Get started creating static chart https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/articles/make-plots.html. Learn create interactive chart https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/articles/make-plots-interactive.html. frequently asked questions page can help tricky syntax aspects using psrcplot: https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/articles/frequently-asked-questions.html.

what: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: function allows create facet bar charts.

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
code: create_facet_bar_chart(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   g,   moe = NULL,   est = "percent",   scales = "free",   facet = 3,   dec = 0,   lpos = "above",   color = "psrc_dark",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   interactive = "no" )

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color bars based g name variable facets moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" est Type numeric values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" scales Value axis facets, either "fixed" "free" - defaults "free" facet Value number columns facet - defaults 3 dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 lpos Position bar labels "" "within" - defaults "" color Name color palette use - generally defaults "psrc_dark" title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" subtitle Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" interactive Enable hover text interactive features - defaults FALSE

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: facet bar chart either static interactive depending choice

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
code: library(dplyr) # Read in the example data and filter to 2020 Population by Race by County df <- psrcplot::mode_share_example_data %>%        filter(Category=="Population by Race" & Year==2020) %>%       filter(Geography!="Region" & Race!="Total")  # Create a facet chart for population by race using counties as the facet my.chart <- create_facet_bar_chart(t=df, x="Race", y="share",                                     fill="Race", g="Geography",                                     facet=2, scales="fixed")

code: create_treemap_chart(   t,   s,   fill,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   est = "percent",   dec = 0,   color = "psrc_light" )

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting s name variable value want use size bars fill name variable want fill bars title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" subtitle Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" est Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_light"

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
text: static treemap chart

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
code: library(dplyr)  # Read in the example data and filter to Mode to Work for Everyone for all years in the data df <- psrcplot::mode_share_example_data %>%        filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%       filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%       mutate(Year = as.character(Year)) %>%       filter(Year=="2020")  my.chart <- create_treemap_chart(t=df, s="share", fill="Mode", title="Mode Share to Work")

title: Generic column/bar workhorse function — generic_column_bar
text: Helper function column_bar_charts

title: Generic column/bar workhorse function — generic_column_bar
code: generic_column_bar(   t,   category_var,   numeric_var,   fill,   pos = "dodge",   est = "percent",   moe = NULL,   href = NULL,   hrefnm = NULL,   hrefcl = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   source = "",   alt = NULL,   category_label = NULL,   numeric_label = NULL,   axis_scale = 1,   column_vs_bar = "column",   dec = 0,   color = "psrc_dark",   interactive = FALSE )

title: Generic column/bar workhorse function — generic_column_bar
text: t tibble long form plotting category_var name category variable numeric_var name variable numeric values plot fill name variable want fill color bars based pos Determines bars side--side(dodge) stacked(stack) - defaults "dodge" est Type numeric values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" href list values used horizontal reference lines - default "NULL" hrefnm list names used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" hrefcl list colors used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" subtitle Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" source Source reference character string, desired - defaults blank alt Text used alt-text, desired - defaults "NULL" category_label category-axis title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" numeric_label numeric-axis title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" axis_scale Enlarge reduce axis weight - defaults 1 column_vs_bar "column": vertical bars "bar": horizontal bars - defaults "column" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 color Name color palette use - generally defaults "psrc_dark" interactive Enable hover text interactive features - defaults FALSE

title: Generic column/bar workhorse function — generic_column_bar
text: static interactive column bar chart

code: generic_line(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   title = "",   est = "number",   dec = 0,   xtype = "Date",   dform = "%b-%Y",   breaks = NULL,   lwidth = 1,   color = "psrc_light",   interactive = FALSE )

title: Generic Line Chart — generic_line
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color bars based title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" est Type numeric values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 xtype Type values X-Axis either "Continuous" "Date", defaults "Date" dform Format Date values breaks Break points use using continuous scale, defaults NULL lwidth Width lines, defaults 1 color Name color palette use - generally defaults "psrc_dark" interactive Enable hover text interactive features - defaults FALSE

title: Generic Line Chart — generic_line
text: line chart
